class_notes:
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Tradition-Christianity.
Topic: Bible: What is the Bible? What does the Bible say? Why do we read it?
The Bible has been the most available and familiar source of intellectual, moral, and spiritual ideals in the West. To provide an overview of the Bible, the course examines the Bible as 'literature' and 'culture.' This course will introduce the Bible as a literary expression of the religious life and thought of ancient communities of faith. Then, the course will move towards the ongoing use, influence, and impact of the Bible on our modern culture. Emphasis will be on the reading of the biblical texts and class discussion.
This course is part of the ECAS Voluntary Core Curriculum Program.
